text:
I write JSP page in cp1251 encoding. Where encoding selected in "page" 
directive.
On disk, source JSP stored in cp1251(Windows-1251), but Tomcat send garbage
(encoding can't be detected), because of Jasper compile page in UTF8 
encoding !!!
If i setup charset=ISO8859_1 in page directive, then page delivered in source 
incoding, but in browser user must manually choose page encoding.
creator: burenkov@nikita.ru
burenkov@nikita.ru
text:
If page compiled by Jasper with directive charset=text/html;ISO8859_1. and 
encoding resolved dynamically <%response.setContentType("text/html;Windows-
1251")%>, then page delivered in source encoding and browser correctly detect 
it!

My be bug not in Jasper - UTF8, may be in JspWriter?

Some encoding-related bugs were fixed in 3.3. Jasper is a different story :-),
I'm working on a solution - but that will happen ( if it will ) much after 
3.3, as part of the effort to refactor and redesign jasper. Not easy, there are
many things screwed - and I would rather rewrite the whole parser then try to
fix bug after bug. If you have a patch, I'll try to put it in 3.3 ( next few
weeks, we hope to have the release !)
